stories.original_headline: The genetic advantage that helps some people stay sharp for life
stories.original_summary: A new study reveals that super agers over 80 have a distinct genetic edge. They are much less likely to carry the gene most associated with Alzheimer’s risk, even when compared with other healthy seniors. stories.fantasy_headline: The Ancient Blessing: Some Elders Keep Minds Sharp
stories.fantasy_story: Wise alchemists have discovered a magical trait in some ancient elders. These special folk are much less likely to suffer from the 'forgetting curse' that troubles others. They carry a protective essence in their very blood, allowing their minds to stay bright for a lifetime.

stories.original_headline: Why some people get bad colds and others don’t
stories.original_summary: Scientists found that nasal cells act as a first line of defense against the common cold, working together to block rhinovirus soon after infection. stories.fantasy_headline: Why Some Battle the Sniffle-Curse Better
stories.fantasy_story: Healers have found that tiny sentry spirits within one's nose act as a first defense against the common sniffle-curse. A swift warding spell by these spirits can stop the invisible ill-spirit before symptoms appear. If a person's inner magic is weak, the ill-spirit spreads, bringing a nasty chill.

stories.fantasy_headline: New Orb Verifies Visions, But Not All Shadow Tricks
stories.fantasy_story: The Ring-Watchers Guild has unveiled a new enchanted scrying orb to confirm the truth of visions. This orb can discern if a recording from a guarding eye has been altered. However, it cannot verify visions that are entirely products of illusionary trickery or shadow puppet enchantments.
